(4) Axway [https://www.axway.com] Catalysts [https://catalysts.axway.com]

  • Small team of experts in the digital transformation and API space
    • Help customers to make good decisions on their API journey
    • Move the community of API practitioners and their practices forward
  • Team members are distributed globally
    • Emmanuel Methivier: @e_methivier [https://twitter.com/e_methivier]
    • Brian Otten: @bottencatalyst [https://twitter.com/bottencatalyst]
    • Eyal Sivan: @mropenbanking [https://twitter.com/mropenbanking]
    • Erik Wilde: @dret [https://twitter.com/dret]


Introduction Erik Wilde (@dret): From Systems to Ecosystems

(5) Some Questions

  • What are major pain points in the IT architecture space?
  • Are there missed opportunities because of IT complexity and speed?
  • Is there a goal of saving money with more effective IT?
  • Is digital transformation a goal and what strategy is in place to make it happen?

Using Digital Building Blocks

Outline (Using Digital Building Blocks)

  1. Introduction [3]
  2. What is an API? [4]
  3. Using Digital Building Blocks [4]
  4. APIs Need Momentum [5]
  5. The API Journey [2]
  6. Conclusions [2]
Using Digital Building Blocks Erik Wilde (@dret): From Systems to Ecosystems

(12) APIs represent Digital Building Blocks

  • Every capability is made available through an API
  • New capabilities are built on existing capabilities
  • The focus is to make all capabilities reusable


Using Digital Building Blocks Erik Wilde (@dret): From Systems to Ecosystems

(13) APIs as Internal Componentization

  • Moving from integration to interconnection (IT modernization)
  • Decoupling components and their development cycles and speed
  • Improving capability reuse across the organization


Using Digital Building Blocks Erik Wilde (@dret): From Systems to Ecosystems

(14) APIs as External Interfaces

  • Direct API monetization (selling APIs as products)
  • Interaction with partners (easier integration)
  • Attracting new business (outsourcing innovation)


Using Digital Building Blocks Erik Wilde (@dret): From Systems to Ecosystems

(15) API Business Model Overview

(17) APIs Need Critical Mass



APIs Need Momentum Erik Wilde (@dret): From Systems to Ecosystems

(18) Size Matters: The Network Effect



APIs Need Momentum Erik Wilde (@dret): From Systems to Ecosystems

(19) Why? The Network Effects Needs a Network

  • It's ineffective to do digital transformation light
  • ROI grows more than linear because options grow more than linear
  • Find lighthouse projects to demonstrate ROI and potential


APIs Need Momentum Erik Wilde (@dret): From Systems to Ecosystems

(20) What? The Platform is a Team Effort

  • Everybody consumes and contributes building blocks
  • Nobody assumes that their product cannot be reused or improved
  • Making APIs the Default [http://dret.net/lectures/api-world-2021/] is effective but not always possible


APIs Need Momentum Erik Wilde (@dret): From Systems to Ecosystems

(21) How? Collaboration Needs Design and Discipline

  • API products are essential as digital building blocks
  • API product thinking is important for designing good building blocks
  • Everybody is building for everybody else


The API Journey

Outline (The API Journey)

  1. Introduction [3]
  2. What is an API? [4]
  3. Using Digital Building Blocks [4]
  4. APIs Need Momentum [5]
  5. The API Journey [2]
  6. Conclusions [2]
The API Journey Erik Wilde (@dret): From Systems to Ecosystems

(23) From Vision to Strategy to Program to Platform

  • The API Vision identifies API as enablers for digital transformation
  • The API Strategy tells the story of how to make APIs a reality
  • The API Program makes sure that the strategy is executed
  • The API Platform provides support for creating and using APIs


The API Journey Erik Wilde (@dret): From Systems to Ecosystems

(24) Measure What Matters: KPIs for APIs

  • APIs aren't the goal
  • Success should be measured at the business level
  • Low-level metrics are useful for improving operations
  • Business-level metrics are useful for measuring success
